verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Oh, the year was 1778, ("How I wish I was in Sherbrook now!") A letter of mark came from the King To the scummiest vessel I've ever seen.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: God damn them all! I was told we'd cruise the seas for American gold We'd fire no guns, shed no tears. Now I'm a broken man on a Halifax Peer, The last of Barrett's Privateers.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Oh, Elcid Barrett cried the town ("How I wish I was in Sherbrook now!") For twenty brave soul all fisherman who Would make for him the "Antelope's" crew

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: The "Antelopes" sloop was a sickening sight ("How I wish I was in Sherbrook now!") She had a list to the port and her sails in rags And the cook in the scuppers with the staggers and jags

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: On the king's birthday we set to sea ("How I wish I was in Sherbrook now!") It was ninety one days to Montigo Bay Pumping like madmen all the way

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: On the ninety sixth day we sailed again ("How I wish I was in Sherbrook now!") When a bloody great Yankee hove in sight With our cracked four-pounders we made to fight.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Oh, the Yankee lay low down with gold ("How I wish I was in Sherbrook now!") She was broad and fat and loose in stays But to catch her took the Antelope two whole days.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: Then at length we stood two cables away ("How I wish I was in Sherbrook now!") Our cracked four-pounders made an awful din But with one fat ball the Yank stove us in

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: Oh, the Antelope shook and pitched on her side ("How I wish I was in Sherbrook now!") Oh Barrett was smashed like a bowl of eggs And the Maintruck carried off both me legs.

verse.name: v9
verse.lines: So here I sit in my twenty-third year ("How I wish I was in Sherbrook now!") It's been six years since I sailed away And I just made Halifax yesterday
